text:
Hi Ben, thanks for sharing. 
Which is technically great thing , looking into reports from Intune and
Windows Server DO already saves a ton of WAN traffic across customers. With this
change we can save even more as Teams Updates are not very small. 
The only concern I have with the push to modern Teams is that there’s quite some
stuff to do for Citrix AVD people and FSLogix doesn’t seem to be very ready.
Still need a preview for working with this all.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/fslogix/overview-release-notes
 
Best regards, 
Karl Wester-Ebbinghaus 
Senior IT Consultant
Microsoft MVP – Azure Hybrid & Migrate / Windows Server 
Von:  <
%24b390c970%241ab25c50%24%40chynet.de

metadata.topic: Forcing Classic Teams users to new Teams
metadata.subject: AW: [patchmanagement] Forcing Classic Teams users to new Teams
metadata.email_text_original:
Sie erhalten nicht oft eine E-Mail von mailtome@chynet.de. Erfahren Sie, warum
dies wichtig ist [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Hi Ben, thanks for sharing. 
Which is technically great thing 😊, looking into reports from Intune and
Windows Server DO already saves a ton of WAN traffic across customers. With this
change we can save even more as Teams Updates are not very small. 
The only concern I have with the push to modern Teams is that there’s quite some
stuff to do for Citrix AVD people and FSLogix doesn’t seem to be very ready.
Still need a preview for working with this all.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/fslogix/overview-release-notes
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Ffslogix%2Foverview-release-notes&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C9a5416f686ff4750eac008dc21f27058%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638422572401197466%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=cQcF7EQmtPeyBNQzuquMc7PBvROGDpbjGkTWThAVu0k%3D&reserved=0] 
Best regards, 
Karl Wester-Ebbinghaus 
Senior IT Consultant
Microsoft MVP – Azure Hybrid & Migrate / Windows Server 
Von: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
